intro: Geigeria hoffmanniana subsp. obovata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geigeria, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It features upright stems with opposite, obovate leaves that have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
